last_episode_to_air.name: The Dawning
last_episode_to_air.overview: Lucy trades lessons in ""home"" to an attractive young drifter who gives her guitar lessons in return.

name: Lassie
overview:
Lassie is an American television series that follows the adventures of a female Rough Collie dog named Lassie and her companions, human and animal. The show was the creation of producer Robert Maxwell and animal trainer Rudd Weatherwax and was televised from September 12, 1954, to March 24, 1973. One of the longest-running series on television, the show chalked up seventeen seasons on CBS before entering first-run syndication for its final two seasons. Initially filmed in black and white, the show transitioned to color in 1965.

The show's first ten seasons follow Lassie's adventures in a small farming community. Fictional eleven-year-old Jeff Miller, his mother, and his grandfather are Lassie's first human companions until seven-year-old Timmy Martin and his adoptive parents take over in the fourth season. When Lassie's exploits on the farm end in the eleventh season, she finds new adventures in the wilderness with a succession of United States Forest Service Rangers. After traveling without human leads for a year, Lassie finally settles at a children's home for her final two syndicated seasons.

Lassie received critical favor at its debut and won two Emmy Awards in its first years. Stars Jan Clayton and June Lockhart were nominated for Emmys. Merchandise produced during the show's run included books, a Halloween costume, clothing, toys, and other items. Campbell's Soup, the show's lifelong sponsor, offered two premiums, and distributed thousands to fans. A multi-part episode was edited into the feature film Lassie's Great Adventure and released in August 1963. In 1989, the television series The New Lassie brought Lassie star Jon Provost back to television as Steve McCullough. Selected episodes have been released to DVD.

seasons.name: Season 1
seasons.overview:
The first season of the television series Lassie premiered in the United States on CBS on September 12, 1954 and ran for 26 episodes until its conclusion on March 6, 1955. Produced by Robert Maxwell, the episodes follows the adventures of a female rough collie named Lassie and her young owner Jeffrey Miller. In 1958, the first through third seasons began syndication under the title "Jeff's Collie."

Though the first season of Lassie has never been released completely to home video, some episodes from the first season have been released to DVD. On November 25, 2003, Classic Media released a three episode set, "Lassie: Best of Jeff's Collie," which included the series first episode, "Inheritance". A second set, "Lassie: 50th Anniversary Collection", was released on September 14, 2004 and contained 24 episodes from across the entire series. The set includes three episodes from the first season: "Inheritance", "The Lion", and "Lassie's Pups".

"Secret of the Silent Hills", composed by William Lava, is used as the opening and ending theme for the entire season.

episodes.name: Inheritance
episodes.overview: Premiere episode. Jeff inherits Lassie from the late Homer Carey, but the young collie seems strangely reluctant to leave the Carey home.

episodes.name: Arithmetic
episodes.overview: Jeff is failing arithmetic due to his problems with fractions, so Ellen tells him he may not go to the circus if he doesn't pass his next test.

episodes.name: The Colt
episodes.overview: To make up for ignoring Jeff, Gramps brings him home a colt Jeff names ""Domino."" Jeff then starts ignoring Lassie in his enthusiasm over having a horse.

episodes.name: The Gun
episodes.overview: Jeff wants to learn to use his father's gun, but Ellen is terrified of him being exposed to a firearm, although Gramps thinks he should learn to use it.

episodes.name: Mr. Peabody
episodes.overview: Gramps hires a tramp to do some odd jobs on the farm, then is jealous when Jeff starts to idolize the tale-telling old man.

episodes.name: The Convict
episodes.overview: Jeff and Lassie meet an escaped convict in the woods.

episodes.name: Feud
episodes.overview: When Gramps quarrels with Matt Brockway after a hotly contested checker game, both men forbid their sons to play with each other. After Jeff and Porky's first attempt to fix the problem goes horribly wrong, so the boys hide in the woods in hopes that in ""saving"" them Gramps and Matt will be friends again.

episodes.name: The Lion
episodes.overview: With Gramps and Ellen away for the day, Jeff and Porky plan a lazy day--until an escaped circus lion invades the farm. Worse, no one will believe them when they call for help.

episodes.name: Gramps
episodes.overview: When Gramps has chest pains, the family tries to keep him from exerting himself.

episodes.name: Lassie's Pups
episodes.overview: Jeff thinks Lassie needs a vet when her time comes, but a storm is brewing and Gramps says dogs can cope. Dr. Wilson: Frank Ferguson. Mrs. Wilson: Frances Morris.

episodes.name: The Job
episodes.overview: A radio producer hears Ellen singing at church and offers her a job singing on radio--but she and Jeff must take an apartment in the city and leave Lassie with Gramps to do it.

episodes.name: The Carnival
episodes.overview: Jeff shows a dog trainer at the fair Lassie's tricks--and thinking she can be a headliner for them, the man and his partner steal her. Clay: Richard Garland.

episodes.name: Sale of Lassie
episodes.overview: Jeff overhears the wrong conversation, and, thinking Gramps needs an expensive operation, attempts to sell Lassie to raise the money.

episodes.name: The Rustlers
episodes.overview: The calf Jeff is raising for the county fair vanishes the same night Lassie comes home injured and covered with mud--then she mysteriously starts chasing Ellen's car.

episodes.name: The Fighter
episodes.overview: Jeff doesn't understand why a famous prizefighter doesn't want to box any longer and pegs him as a coward.

episodes.name: The Contest
episodes.overview: While Jeff prepares for the county fair, a spoiled little girl visits the farm and continually tries to hurt Lassie.

episodes.name: Runaways
episodes.overview: After Lassie is suspected of having rabies, she's about to be taken to the pound--but Jeff runs away with her. Clay: Richard Garland. Brockway: Paul Maxey.

episodes.name: The Brat
episodes.overview: Ellen offers the boys a special treat if they will babysit a boy while she is called out on an errand. But the kid turns out to be more than Jeff and Porky can handle.

episodes.name: Father
episodes.overview: The church is holding a father-son event and Jeff doesn't want Gramps to fill in for his dad. Jeff is then even more embarrassed when Ellen decides to accompany him instead.

episodes.name: The Fawn
episodes.overview: Jeff wants to adopt an orphan fawn, but Gramps says there is no place for wild animals on a farm.

episodes.name: Blind Soldier
episodes.overview: The parents of a blind veteran try to buy Lassie--the young man's own collie Lassie has died and they do not want to tell him the truth, fearing he will slip into depression again.

episodes.name: The Cave
episodes.overview: Jeff and Lassie are trapped in a cave shown to them by a malicious classmate.

episodes.name: The Injury
episodes.overview: An injured man, hurt in a car accident, is brought to the farm. He mutters something about hitting a collie with his car--and Lassie is acting strangely.

episodes.name: The Well
episodes.overview: A snoopy inspector from the water department insists on seeing the Miller well.

episodes.name: The Snake
episodes.overview: Jeff is bitten by a rattlesnake and Gramps and Ellen rush to get him to a doctor.

episodes.name: The Bear
episodes.overview: Jeff and Porky's campout is ruined by a persistent bear.

1.name: Season 1
1.overview:
The first season of the television series Lassie premiered in the United States on CBS on September 12, 1954 and ran for 26 episodes until its conclusion on March 6, 1955. Produced by Robert Maxwell, the episodes follows the adventures of a female rough collie named Lassie and her young owner Jeffrey Miller. In 1958, the first through third seasons began syndication under the title "Jeff's Collie."

Though the first season of Lassie has never been released completely to home video, some episodes from the first season have been released to DVD. On November 25, 2003, Classic Media released a three episode set, "Lassie: Best of Jeff's Collie," which included the series first episode, "Inheritance". A second set, "Lassie: 50th Anniversary Collection", was released on September 14, 2004 and contained 24 episodes from across the entire series. The set includes three episodes from the first season: "Inheritance", "The Lion", and "Lassie's Pups".

"Secret of the Silent Hills", composed by William Lava, is used as the opening and ending theme for the entire season.

episodes.name: The Runt
episodes.overview: All of Lassie's pups have been given away except for Laddie, the runt, and she hides him in an abandoned mineshaft to keep him with her.

episodes.name: The Pit
episodes.overview: When Jeff and Porky see pit bull terriers, Gramps suspects illegal dogfights are being held in the area.

episodes.name: The Kittens
episodes.overview: Jeff and Lassie find a litter of abandoned kittens and are horrified when Gramps says to leave them alone; that they can't be saved and will probably starve.

episodes.name: The Dog Show
episodes.overview: Porky enters Lassie in the Capitol City Dog Show obedience trials without knowing what the procedure is, but Jeff finds out what's involved and trains her.

episodes.name: The School
episodes.overview: A new teacher has forbidden the children from bringing dogs into the classroom and one of Jeff's classmates is determined to do something about it.

episodes.name: The Violin
episodes.overview: Jeff teaches Lassie to howl when he plays the violin, hoping to get out of lessons, but Ellen sees through the scheme

episodes.name: The Monster
episodes.overview: There is a weird ""monster"" in the lake making unearthly noises--but it turns out to be a displaced seal, which Jeff promptly tries to adopt.

episodes.name: The Witch
episodes.overview: Lassie comes down with an odd ailment. The kids are convinced that a creepy old lady they call the "witch woman" has cast a spell on the dog.

episodes.name: The Wild Duck
episodes.overview: Jeff nurses a wild duck back to health but when he releases it back to the wild, he fears the duck may be the victim of poachers in the area.

episodes.name: The Rival
episodes.overview: Jeff and Gramps are jealous when Clay Horton takes Ellen out on a date.

episodes.name: The Newspaper
episodes.overview: The boys start printing a newspaper to make themselves some pocket money--but the material they print gets them into hot water instead.

episodes.name: The Clown
episodes.overview: After an itinerant clown and his dog entertain at a church carnival, the man is accused of robbing a neighbor.

episodes.name: The Twister
episodes.overview: The Millers batten down the hatches as a severe storm approaches.

episodes.name: Gramps' Birthday
episodes.overview: Jeff and Ellen plan a surprise party for Gramps so well that Gramps feels neglected on his birthday and ""runs away.""

episodes.name: The Gypsies
episodes.overview: A gypsy girl and her family camp on the Miller farm, despite neighbors' reports of thievery.

episodes.name: The Gift
episodes.overview: A television set meant for the Brockways is delivered to the Millers.

episodes.name: The Stamp Album
episodes.overview: In a quest for a valuable stamp, the boys begin quarreling with each other.

episodes.name: The Dog Catcher
episodes.overview: When Lassie is impounded in Capitol City for lack of tag and leash, Jeff learns that most of the dogs in the pound are to be killed so he brings, much to the consternation of Ellen, the dogs to the farm so he can find them homes.

episodes.name: Pokey
episodes.overview: Matt Brockway says Pokey is useless and tells Porky he is going to give the dog away.

episodes.name: The Trial
episodes.overview: When Gramps refuses to sell the farm to nasty Emmet Carey, Edgar Carey pretends that a barbed wire scratch he got in the barn is Lassie's bite, figuring the Millers will give up the farm before giving up Lassie

episodes.name: The Hawk
episodes.overview: Jeff and Porky horrify Gramps by trying to tame a red-tailed hawk as a hunting falcon.

episodes.name: The Tree House
episodes.overview: The boys quarrel over Pokey being able to sleep in their new tree house.

episodes.name: The Visitor
episodes.overview: The Millers welcome a Japanese exchange student--and run into bigotry from a neighbor who has never gotten over World War II.

episodes.name: The Raft
episodes.overview: The boys' journey on their new raft is hampered by the fact that Porky can't swim.

episodes.name: The Journey
episodes.overview: When Gramps and Ellen tell him that Lassie is going blind, Jeff takes the dog on a long journey to find the doctor that can restore her sight.

episodes.name: The Vet
episodes.overview: Jeff decides he wants to be a veterinarian, and his first patient is the Miller cow.

episodes.name: Lassie's Double
episodes.overview: Ellen accidentally brings home a valuable champion collie from a dog show rather than Lassie--and is accused of theft!

episodes.name: The Child
episodes.overview: Jeff and Porky, told to babysit little Janie, leave the child with Lassie while they run to see construction equipment at work, not knowing Janie is following them.

episodes.name: The Leash
episodes.overview: After a friend's mother is involved in a serious car accident, Jeff becomes over protective of Lassie.

episodes.name: Sunday School
episodes.overview: Jeff, in charge of collecting money for Sunday School, loses the contributions and has no way of replacing them.

episodes.name: The Deer Hunter
episodes.overview: Jeff discovers that a new classmate's father is jacklighting deer.

episodes.name: Domino
episodes.overview: A disreputable horse dealer schemes to buy Jeff's colt cheaply by proving to Gramps that the horse is vicious.

episodes.name: The Marauder
episodes.overview: One of Lassie's puppies, Comet, mistreated by its owner, has turned wild.

episodes.name: The Calf
episodes.overview: Jeff and Porky enter the world of business when they take a 4-H calf home from the county's fair, intent on raising it to sell for the price of an outboard motor. In their care, the calf grows into a prize-winning heifer.

episodes.name: The Crop Duster
episodes.overview: Gramps' blames Lassie's son Laddie's illness on the spray used by a local crop duster.

episodes.name: War Dog
episodes.overview: Jeff persuades a neighbor to buy a rehabilitated war dog, only to have the dog exhibit aggressive behavior. Joe Brown: James Griffith.

episodes.name: The Haircut
episodes.overview: Ellen battles with Jeff to go get a haircut--until the unexpected happens.

episodes.name: Diane
episodes.overview: Jeff and Porky quarrel over a new girl in town, who is happily playing one boy off another!

episodes.name: The Frog
episodes.overview: When Jeff and Porky discover their competition jumping frog is female and about to lay eggs, they drive Gramps and Ellen to exhaustion in their quest to see the eggs are fertilized and produce offspring.

episodes.name: Bee Hive
episodes.overview: Jeff and Porky try to raise bees for an upcoming 4H show but a wild raccoon threatens to ruin their work.

episodes.name: Friendship
episodes.overview: Cranky old Daniel Mueller fences in a pasture that's a shortcut the kids use going and coming to school and the boys want revenge, but Lassie is privy to his gentle side. Then one night the collie discovers Mueller seriously ill.

episodes.name: Quarantine
episodes.overview: Pokey is temporarily quarantined at the Miller farm due to a disease threat. However, when the dog runs away, one of the Miller's neighbors threatens to shoot Pokey on sight to protect his livestock.

episodes.name: Bone
episodes.overview: Lassie uncovers a bone that is of interest to a local archaeologist but Pokey takes it away when she tries to bury it.

episodes.name: The Watch
episodes.overview: Ellen tries to teach Jeff a lesson about being on time but Jeff takes the idea a little too far.

episodes.name: Hoax
episodes.overview: Jeff and Porky send Lassie on a fake call for help but when Jeff is injured and does need help, people are skeptical that the need is genuine.

episodes.name: The Fish Story
episodes.overview: Jeff and Porky enter a fishing contest to win a new pole, but it's Lassie that catches the fish!

episodes.name: Transfusion
episodes.overview: Pokey needs a blood transfusion to save her life and only Lassie has the blood needed for the transfusion.

episodes.name: Local Elections
episodes.overview: Gramps is going fishing on the day of local elections and Ellen is worried that his absence from voting could mean a man who dislikes all dogs is elected as animal catcher for the area.

episodes.name: Gossip
episodes.overview: Jeff misunderstands a man who gives him a ride--and the newcomer is branded as an ex-convict.

episodes.name: Fish Conservation
episodes.overview: With a drought affecting availability of fish in the area, two restaurant owners look to take advantage of the Miller's generosity by taking free fish from the Miller's lake.

episodes.name: Challenge
episodes.overview: Ellen makes Jeff promise to stop taking on dares from other people. However, his promise is tested when a mischievous boy takes his report card and leaves it atop a phone pole.

episodes.name: Tractor
episodes.overview: Gramps wins a tractor in a contest but refuses to learn how to use it even after his first attempts go poorly.

episodes.name: Goats
episodes.overview: To earn money for a motor for his bike, Jeff agrees to take care of Jim Teal's goats while he's fencing in their new pasture. But the rambunctious animals run Jeff-- and Lassie, Porky, and the family--ragged

episodes.name: A Place For Everything
episodes.overview: Ellen enlists Lassie's help to teach Jeff to pick up after himself but things don't turn out as planned.

episodes.name: Party Line
episodes.overview: Jeff discovers that the reason for Jenny's grumpiness is that no one remembered her birthday.

episodes.name: Superstition
episodes.overview: Porky is upset when a black cat crosses Lassie's path and then she walks under a ladder, but Jeff and Ellen tell him superstitions are silly--but Jeff may be converted when unfortunate things keep happening.

episodes.name: Goodbye Forever
episodes.overview: After being punished for something he didn't do, Porky tells Jeff that he's running away. Jeff asks Porky to stick around in the hope that he can convince him not to leave.

episodes.name: Lassie's Vanity
episodes.overview: Lassie is praised for her looks after a visit to a pet salon and she takes the compliments a little too much to heart.

episodes.name: Champion
episodes.overview: Jeff persuades Gramps to enter a turkey shoot, even though Gramps doesn't think his eyesight is good enough.

episodes.name: Vigil
episodes.overview: A little dog left in Jeff's care pines for his missing master.

episodes.name: Chimp
episodes.overview: Porky and Jeff receive a chimpanzee by mail instead of the hamsters ordered. When they try and hide the chimp from everyone, they discover that the task is far more difficult than they imagined.

episodes.name: Lassie's Day
episodes.overview: With the Millers and Brockways attending a wedding, Lassie and Pokey set out on a series of adventures.

episodes.name: The Rock
episodes.overview: A baseball that gets misplaced during rock collecting for a school exhibit causes a rift between Jeff and Porky.

episodes.name: The Artist
episodes.overview: Jeff tries his hand in matchmaking by matching Gramps up with an artist that is staying at a nearby cottage.

episodes.name: Survival
episodes.overview: Porky and Jeff spend a night roughing it in the woods but their tranquility is threatened by a nearby camper's carless fire tending.

episodes.name: Bird Watchers
episodes.overview: While Porky and Jeff go off to identify birds for a school project, Lassie tends bird eggs whose mother was killed by a ferret.

episodes.name: The Dog House
episodes.overview: Lassie feels she is being punished when she is made to sleep outside in a dog house built by Gramps.

episodes.name: The Search
episodes.overview: Gramps heads out on a secret fishing trip just as a bad storm approaches the area.

episodes.name: Boy's Day
episodes.overview: Jeff and Porky are sheriffs on the town's annual boy's day, so Gramps cooks up a fake robbery to give them a little excitement.

episodes.name: The Snob
episodes.overview: After visiting to Timothy Powell's summer home, Jeff is envious of the wonderful things he saw at the wealthy Powells and turns up his nose at the farm and Porky. So when the Powells go away for the weekend, Ellen has Timmy stay with the Millers.When Timothy falls seriously ill, however, it is Ellen's unwavering care that brings about his recovery, and Jeff realizes that money isn't everything and Jeff finds out the boy thinks he's the lucky one.

episodes.name: Haunted House
episodes.overview: On a dare, Porky and Jeff venture into a supposed haunted house and are surprised to see what appears to be a real ghost.

episodes.name: The Nest
episodes.overview: Gramps is determined to use the mower before the onset of bad weather but Jeff and Porky are just as set to protect a nest atop the machine that belongs to a rare bird.

episodes.name: Father Ellen
episodes.overview: To cheer Jeff up, Ellen tries to join him for several outdoor activities but he thinks she is doing it as she needs to be cheered up.

episodes.name: Poverty
episodes.overview: Under the mistaken belief that the farm is about to foreclosed on, Jeff adopts a frugal outlook on his daily life.

episodes.name: The Apple Tree
episodes.overview: With the apple orchard partly ruined by rabbits, Gramps contemplates selling the farm.

episodes.name: The Harvesters
episodes.overview: Nearby squatters have Jud Perkins determined to try and be rid of them but Jeff wants to help them.

episodes.name: Jeff's Moustache
episodes.overview: Jeff talks about growing a moustache but when he starts acting older than he actually is, Gramps decides to teach him a lesson.

episodes.name: The Runaway
episodes.overview: Lassie discovers a small, waiflike boy hiding in the barn, but the child won't talk. The Millers soon find out he's Timmy, an orphan living in Olive Branch with his elderly relatives, Uncle Jed and Aunt Abby Clausen. (Some type of accident killed Timmy's parents.)

episodes.name: The Suit
episodes.overview: Timmy is so excited about his new suit that Ellen allows him to wear it until Jeff gets home, but when he tears it, afraid they will send him back to his aunt and uncle, Timmy lies and lays the blame on Lassie. To make him confess, Ellen makes him decide Lassie's punishment.

episodes.name: Graduation
episodes.overview: Jeff is thrilled to accept a summer job at Doc Weaver's office, but when he neglects his duty for a few minutes, a potentially rabid dog is let loose

episodes.name: The Burro
episodes.overview: When Timmy and Lassie find a sick burro, abandoned by neglectful but well-meaning owners, everyone thinks Timmy's exaggerating until Ellen finds the creature. Timmy's faith and the family's nursing save the burro, but then her owners come return.

episodes.name: The Berry Pickers
episodes.overview: With Jeff at the dentist, Timmy and Gramps go out to pick huckleberries for pies for the church supper. Timmy thinks Gramps is ill when he naps after berrying, but it's Timmy who must be rescued after eating nightshade berries.

episodes.name: The Raccoon
episodes.overview: Timmy and Jeff nurse an injured raccoon against protests from Gramps--and ""Sam"" repays them by wreaking havoc in kitchen, barn, and chicken coop. Released to the wild, he returns to begin stealing things from the house.

episodes.name: The Ballerina
episodes.overview: Jeff tries every way he can to avoid meeting Debbie, the daughter of Ellen's visiting college roommate Lucy Hopkins--until he sees her dance and is smitten. But when Porky lampoons her dancing, Debbie tells both boys off.

episodes.name: The Elephant
episodes.overview: Jeff and Timmy saw a huge elephant. Ellen & Gramps doesn't want it as an 2nd Pet for Lassie. They decided to keep it until the animal control person comes by and wanted to get rid of the elephant.

episodes.name: Timmy's Family
episodes.overview: Timmy believes he and Lassie are unloved and unwanted by the Martins, and sends Lassie to the Millers in Capitol City. Ellen Miller, knowing that Timmy is mistaken, returns to the farm to reunite Timmy with his loving adoptive parents.

episodes.name: The Bike
episodes.overview: Timmy borrows a bike to learn to ride, but when the bike is stolen, he must replace the stolen one with his new bicycle. The situation is resolved when Lassie plays detective to hunt down the bike thief.

episodes.name: The Crisis
episodes.overview: Paul, Timmy, and Lassie are stranded on a deserted road when Paul realizes Timmy is becoming seriously ill. Lassie must risk her life to bring help to the sick child.

episodes.name: The Business
episodes.overview: When Timmy and Scott launch a bait-worm selling business, their only potential customer refuses to buy anything. He changes his mind, however, when Lassie saves him from drowning.

episodes.name: The Ring
episodes.overview: Timmy believes one of Uncle Petrie's tall tales and is hurt to discover he has been lied to. A gift of a friendship ring, crafted by Uncle Petrie himself, mends their relationship.

episodes.name: The Pony
episodes.overview: Timmy comes running home with a story about a rabbit-sized pony--but no one believes him.

episodes.name: Sinbad
episodes.overview: To replace Uncle Petrie broken guitar Timmy enters a borrowed parrot in a contest to win the prize of a new guitar.

episodes.name: The Square Dance
episodes.overview: Timmy refuses to attend the Grange Square Dance out of fear that he will have to dance with a girl. After Uncle Petrie reassures him this will not happen, he relents. To everyone's surprise, a fire disrupts the children's dance and Lassie must save the day.

episodes.name: The Garden
episodes.overview: A drought is hitting the area pretty hard, and Timmy desperately attempts to keep his own small garden from perishing.

episodes.name: Concussion
episodes.overview: When Timmy insists on going to a blasting site despite Lassie's protests, she is struck on the head by a dynamite-propelled rock and appears to not know who she is. Then she wanders away from the farm.

episodes.name: The Hungry Deer
episodes.overview: Members of the community band together to hunt down deer driven to eat their crops, but Timmy and Scott fight to do something that doesn't involve killing them.

episodes.name: The Hospital
episodes.overview: Timmy is stricken with severe stomach cramps and keeps calling out for Lassie.

episodes.name: The Penguin
episodes.overview: A crate holding a penguin enroute to the Capitol City zoo falls off its truck, and Timmy and Scott adopt the creature

episodes.name: The Bird House
episodes.overview: Timmy tends an injured sparrow.

episodes.name: Seeing Eye Dog
episodes.overview: When Lassie finds an injured seeing-eye dog, the family searches in vain for the dog's owner. The situation appears hopeless until Lassie leads them to the dog's missing collar, and a telephone call to Capitol City Hospital reunites dog and owner.

episodes.name: Junior Firemen
episodes.overview: Timmy becomes overzealous in his efforts to spot fire hazards to win a contest.

episodes.name: The Blanket
episodes.overview: Ruth tries to replace Lassie's disreputable old blanket with a new one, but Lassie will have none of it.

episodes.name: The Rabbits
episodes.overview: Timmy's new rabbits take precedence over Lassie.

episodes.name: The Cub Scout
episodes.overview: Scott's city cousins make fun of Timmy and Scott's interest in the Cub Scouts

episodes.name: The Crow
episodes.overview: Timmy's ""patient,"" an injured crow he names ""Peck,"" recovers to become a farm pest.

episodes.name: The Mother
episodes.overview: On the sly, Lassie tends some orphaned puppies.

episodes.name: The House Guest
episodes.overview: Timmy becomes annoyed with a house guest of Ruth when all she can talk about is all the finer things Ruth is missing by living on a farm.

episodes.name: The Sermon
episodes.overview: Inspired by Uncle Petrie's tale of a boy who talks to the animals, Timmy sets out to befriend animals himself. But he helps some people along the way and it is their friendship and kindness that save Lassie from a precarious situation.

episodes.name: The Storm
episodes.overview: Timmy and Boomer try to teach Boomer's new dog Mike, a distant little terrier, farm ways, but he seems unable to learn.

episodes.name: Wishing
episodes.overview: Uncle Petrie allows Timmy to ride a pony at a pony-ride concession, and Timmy falls in love with the animal--so Lassie sneaks out in the night and brings ""Star"" home.

episodes.name: The Teacher
episodes.overview: Timmy and his classmates adore their teacher Miss Hazlit, and when they find out she may have to leave because of budget constraints, they try to earn the money to keep her on. But the money is lost on their way to speak to the school board.

episodes.name: The Owl
episodes.overview: Timmy and Boomer are so desperate to be useful that Ruth entrusts a fresh egg delivery to the boys, but they're sidetracked by an aggressive barn ow1 after they try to replace two broken eggs.

episodes.name: The Crash
episodes.overview: Timmy and Boomer run to see a plane crash and don't know what to do when they find the injured pilot in the wreckage.

episodes.name: The Rocking Chair
episodes.overview: Lassie falls in love with a rocking chair destined for donation to a benefit sale, and when it's sold, she determines to do something to get it back.

episodes.name: Fish Out of Water
episodes.overview: Timmy brings home a rainbow trout with plans to keep it as a pet, but the idea engenders all sorts of obstacles.

episodes.name: Trapped
episodes.overview: When Timmy and Boomer discover there will be girls at the Halloween party they are looking forward to, they go out hunting for foxfire to smear on their faces so girls won't kiss them and are trapped in an abandoned house.

episodes.name: Our Gal
episodes.overview: Paul's expensive new sow ""Our Gal"" turns out to have an unfortunate predeliction zfor running away, even through reinforced fencing, and after she has a litter of piglets.

episodes.name: Lassie's Decision
episodes.overview: Timmy's plan to help his new friend Henry, who is afraid of dogs, backfires when Henry mistakes Lassie's extra attention as love for him and believes she wants to stay with him.

episodes.name: The Egret
episodes.overview: On a bird-watching expedition for school, Timmy sees a rare snowy egret, but no one will believe him. Finally a professor is dispatched to see if his report is true.

episodes.name: The Archers
episodes.overview: After bow hunters shoot a bear cub, then leave it in the forest to die, the Martins try to save the animal.

episodes.name: The Bundle from Britain
episodes.overview: Boomer is jealous when Timmy seems to prefer the company of his English visitor, Robin, and his little Cairn terrier Basil, so he and a classmate make fun of Robin's short pants and school tie

episodes.name: The Black Woods
episodes.overview: Having seen sugar maples while taking Timmy on a nature hike, Uncle Petrie returns to the woods to investigate--and runs into two men holding bank president Robert Hanson hostage. Remembering that he taught Timmy smoke signals on their hike, he makes a desperate gamble while helping one of the criminals make a fire.

episodes.name: The Raffle
episodes.overview: Tongues wag in the neighborhood after Lassie picks Ruth's ticket as a winner in a raffle for a piano--but the real loser is Timmy, who's forced to take lessons

episodes.name: The Christmas Story
episodes.overview: Several days before Christmas, Lassie is struck by a truck while saving a three-year-old girl and so seriously injured she needs a special veterinarian to operate on her

episodes.name: The Lady Bugs
episodes.overview: Timmy and Boomer want to be partners in a business, and, learning Paul is planning to spend $10 on ladybugs to help fight aphids in his apple orchard, are determined to find a cache of them Lassie discovered earlier. But the collie wants nothing to do with the itchy pests

episodes.name: Junior GI's
episodes.overview: The Army is conducting war games near the farm, and excited Timmy, Boomer, and their friends plan their own maneuvers. But it's no game when scout Timmy and his ""war dog"" Lassie wander into a live mine field!

episodes.name: The Big Cat
episodes.overview: Ruth, taking a woods shortcut on her way to a Grange supper and having to replace a flat tire, is caught in a trap set by a state hunter to catch a marauding cougar.

episodes.name: The Tree
episodes.overview: For a club project, Timmy and Boomer adopt a tree that was supposedly planted by Johnny Appleseed, then discover it is sleighted to be cut down to make way for a highway, so Timmy writes a letter to the President of the United States.

episodes.name: Timmy,The Oil Millionaire
episodes.overview: When Lassie keeps coming home with greasy muck on her legs, Timmy and Boomer investigate, and discover a pool of oil on their property. But Uncle Petrie's investigation of the pool proves to be his undoing.

episodes.name: Beholden
episodes.overview: Asa Winkler, a conniving handyman, claims Lassie bit him and tore his pants to obtain odd jobs at the Martins--and arranges other ""accidents"" to stay on.

episodes.name: Tartan Queen
episodes.overview: A breeder says Lassie may be descended from a famous show dog and urges Timmy not to let her run wild, so she must sit on the sidelines while Boomer's terrier Mike has all the fun.

episodes.name: The Horse Show
episodes.overview: Timmy, disappointed that there are no contests in the county fair a small boy can participate in, enters his burro Lucky in a farm horse event.

episodes.name: The Cat That Came to Dinner
episodes.overview: The Martins adopt a cat they find half-drowned outside the house, but the conniving cat, dubbed ""Marmalade"" by Timmy because of his color, immediately starts getting Lassie into trouble.

episodes.name: The Bonnet
episodes.overview: Knowing Ruth hasn't had a new hat in four years, Paul buys her a lovely spring hat he discovers she was longing for, but Timmy and Lassie inadvertently ruin it while playing.

episodes.name: The Puppy Story
episodes.overview: Timmy and Boomer are heartbroken when they find out Lassie's puppies are to be sold, so Lassie hides them in an old pen in the woods. But the mischevious babies get free.

episodes.name: The Young Flyers
episodes.overview: The entire family pitches in to help Timmy win in his Cub Scout troop's kite-flying contest, especially after the original kite is lost.

episodes.name: The Watch Dog
episodes.overview: Lassie, staying at a neighbor's house while the family as at the county fair, is blamed for the damage done by Chipper, a chimpanzee being nursed by Mrs. Collins.

episodes.name: The Puppet
episodes.overview: Lassie falls in love with Suzy, a canine hand puppet manipulated by a down-on-his-luck ventriloquist.

episodes.name: Rock Hound
episodes.overview: Timmy and Boomer are convinced that their new neighbor is a bank robber.

episodes.name: Teamwork
episodes.overview: Timmy and Boomer heartily disagree over the methods and tasks involved in the construction of a lean to but learn to work together when the boys and Lassie must rescue Boomer's visiting cousin Millicent from a cave ledge.

episodes.name: Stable Mates
episodes.overview: Lassie befriends a stray dog and finds a rambunctious runaway show horse which, after Lassie trains the stray dog to be a stable mate, becomes more calm.

episodes.name: The Camera
episodes.overview: While helping Timmy get pictures for a photo contest Paul and Uncle Petrie comes across a uncooperative man hunting pheasants on the Martin property.

episodes.name: Peace Patrol
episodes.overview: Timmy wants his school to participate in The Lone Ranger Peace Patrol program encouraging children to save their money to buy saving bonds to support the United States.

episodes.name: Swami
episodes.overview: At the church carnival Timmy and Boomer dresses Lassie as a fortune teller but it does not goes as they planned.

episodes.name: Campout
episodes.overview: An unprepared city boy who has after a quarrel run away from his uncle with whom he is visiting leads Timmy and Boomer who are camping out in the Martin barn into danger in the woods.

episodes.name: Lassie's Guest
episodes.overview: When Boomer goes on an overnight visit, Mike who has been left in Timmy's care becomes shut in the trunk of the Martin's car while chasing his ball and taken to a garage where a fire starts.

episodes.name: The New Refrigerator
episodes.overview: Ruth loves her new refrigerator, but Lassie prefers meals from the old icebox instead--precipitating a battle of wills.

episodes.name: Old Henry
episodes.overview: Timmy buys an old plowhorse for a dollar, but Paul says they cannot keep the animal since he can't do any work. In trying earn money to keep the horse, Timmy becomes trapped in a mine.

episodes.name: The Contest
episodes.overview: Timmy enters a ""why I love my pet"" contest and entrusts Lassie to get the entry to the mailman on time, but she spends so much time aiding neighbors in trouble that the letter is not delivered.

episodes.name: The Mascot
episodes.overview: Baseball great Roy Campanella comes to coach the Calverton Boys' League just as Timmy puts in a bid for Lassie to become the team's mascot. But when Timmy overhears two boys bargaining over who will pitch the first game and is threatened that Lassie will not get the mascot position if he tells, he's thrown in a quandary.

episodes.name: The Sulky Race
episodes.overview: A down-on-his-luck horse racer who needs to win just one more race to start his own farm boards his two harness horses, Big Boy, his future stud horse, and Lazy Joe, Big Boy's stablemate, at the Martin farm. But at an early time-trial, Big Boy turns up lame.

episodes.name: Growing Pains
episodes.overview: After Timmy gets a ""real shiner"" in a fight, Ruth can't understand the self-respect he's gained with his larger classmates and forbids him to play football with them.

episodes.name: The Flying Machine
episodes.overview: As the smallest in the group, Timmy chosen to be test pilot for the gang's homemade glider. But the test flight will be held over a cliff.

episodes.name: The UNICEF Story
episodes.overview: On a windy night, Lassie hears screaming coming from the woods, and upon investigating, finds a foreign girl named Anna wandering about lost. Befriending the girl, Lassie brings her home to the Martins. They discover she is a European girl that the Wilkins family has taken in temporarily. She is enrolled in the Calverton school and Timmy begins acclimating her to the area by taking her on a picnic. He notices she always eats as if she is starving; at first he does not notice that she is also hoarding food. Anna is continually coming in late, and then Miss Hazlit begins having complaints from Rudy that things are disappearing from the childrens' lunch boxes. When Rudy accuses Anna in front of the other kids, Timmy fights with him until Miss Hazlit breaks it up and makes Rudy apologize. Timmy comes home, however, and overhears Miss Hazlit telling Ruth that she also suspects that Anna is the thief. Timmy is disturbed, but agrees to let Miss Hazlit take care of the matter. In the meantime,

episodes.name: Water Boy
episodes.overview: Paul needs a new well, and Cully Wilson swears he can find water with a divining rod rather than Paul hiring an expensive geologist.

episodes.name: The Whopper
episodes.overview: Ruth is disturbed by the tall tales Timmy is telling to impress Willy Brewster--a problem compounded when he tells Willy and Flip that Mrs. Larson, a new neighbor living in a run-down house, is a witch.

episodes.name: The Bounty Hunter
episodes.overview: Due to stock killings by a puma nicknamed ""Satan,"" the local farmers hire a bounty hunter, a curt, unlikable man whose tracking dog King and Lassie immediately strike sparks off one another.

episodes.name: The Land Grabber
episodes.overview: After Paul refuses to consider selling his land to a real estate broker, someone ruins his tomato crop and sets fire to his hay.

episodes.name: The Man from Mars
episodes.overview: When Timmy sees a meteorite come down, he's sure it was really a spaceship from another planet--and that a man from Mars is wandering around the farm. Funny thing is: food keeps disappearing from the Martin house!

episodes.name: In Case of Emergency
episodes.overview: After a local farmer dies on the way to the Capitol City hospital, fifty miles away, the Martins spearhead a plan to start a community hospital, but a prominent farmer known as a skinflint refuses his approval.

episodes.name: Star Reporter
episodes.overview: Timmy persuades editor Ira Caldwell to let him try and earn money by selling newspaper subscriptions to the Calverton Sentinel,and then accidently overhears a plan to rob the local dairy's co-op while at the Vance farm.

episodes.name: Alias Jack and Joe
episodes.overview: During a game, the boys begin fighting and Flip is knocked out by a rock thrown by Rudy, who makes Timmy and Sam believe Flip is dead and it's their fault, so the two boys and Lassie run away to avoid disgracing their families.

episodes.name: Judas Goat
episodes.overview: Phil Houston's stockyards suddenly gets a new source of lambs for market thanks to his assistant Joe Morton and Lassie seems to be reacting to strange noises not coming from the new silent dog whistle Timmy recently purchased.

episodes.name: The Space Traveler
episodes.overview: When Timmy and Don accidentally release the guinea pig from an experimental rocket, they replace it with Timmy's guinea pig Alexander the Great. But authorities suspect the guinea pig on the rocket was exposed to deadly radiation.

episodes.name: The Maverick
episodes.overview: large mongrel dog who's been a nuisance on neighbors' farms is trapped in a gorge, and although most of the farmers want the stray dead, the Calverton dog pound representative wants to save him.

episodes.name: The Grasshopper and the Ant
episodes.overview: Timmy, studying grasshoppers for a school project, becomes so worried about a possible plague when he sees a big nest of the insects that he speaks up at the Grange meeting and tries to buy insecticide with his own money. It's only then that even Paul takes him seriously--and is glad he did.

episodes.name: Homing Pigeon
episodes.overview: After he trades some old sports equipment for a homing pigeon, Timmy's next task is to train her. But only Lassie--and a male pigeon attracted to the new homer--knows ""Bright Eyes"" is endangered by a hawk on her first long-distance flight.

episodes.name: The Explorers
episodes.overview: After an Explorer lectures Timmy's Cub Scout den, the inspired den goes on a hike and wonder into the Badlands where they become stranded on a rock ledge.

episodes.name: The Epidemic
episodes.overview: When Paul tends a neighbor's herd, he discovers they have hoof-and-mouth disease--and now Princess, the new purebred cow he invested $1000 in, and the Martin's old cow Bessie are threatened with slaughter.

episodes.name: Fur-Coated Killer
episodes.overview: A neighbor may lose his new means of moneymaking when minks from his mink farm are blamed for slaughtering chickens. But the killer turns out to be something more dangerous: a wolverine.

episodes.name: Judgment Seat
episodes.overview: The father of a new girl Timmy befriends owns the land Paul is renting for his alfalfa crop--and plans to flood the field before Paul can harvest it.

episodes.name: The Elephant
episodes.overview: After Timmy and other schoolchildren saved up enough money to purchase an baby elephant for the Capitol City Zoo, the city authorities find there is no place to house it, so, newly named ""Peanuts"" by Timmy, it ends up boarding at the Martin farm.

episodes.name: Clementine
episodes.overview: Timmy saves the life of a rooster that Paul only suspects was involved in cockfighting, but a neighbor's hired hand recognizes ""Clementine"" as a champion fighter named Dynamite who was left for dead.

episodes.name: The Puppy Sitter
episodes.overview: Lassie, who turns out not to be expecting puppies, refuses to have anything to do with Henry Enders' setter puppies that Timmy is taking care of.

episodes.name: The Champ
episodes.overview: Everyone makes fun of Timmy's runt piglet, Champ.

episodes.name: The Phone Hog
episodes.overview: Paul is trapped in his truck by a downed power line during an electrical storm, but Timmy can't call for help because a garrilous woman is constantly on the telephone.

episodes.name: The Chase
episodes.overview: After watching two callous city hunters and their rented dog ruin a neighbor's fence, Timmy and Cully Wilson lead the men on a chase through the forest using a young raccoon's scent as bait. It's a grand practical joke--until one of the unexperienced men accidentally shoots the other.

episodes.name: The Killer
episodes.overview: Sam Burke buys a savage German Shepherd named Bismarck after a bobcat depredates his flock of sheep and attacks the Martin stock as well, leaving a lamb orphaned--but Lassie knows that something else was responsible for the killings.

episodes.name: The Moved Monument
episodes.overview: Paul, Henry Enders, and some other farmers may lose some valuable farmland--and Paul an expensive fence--due to a road building project. Henry Enders tells the Martins he understands some of the original survey markers were once moved, so the two men try to find any that were not replaced.

episodes.name: The Alligator
episodes.overview: Flip will get Timmy's turtle Myrtle if Lassie behaves like the greedy dog in Aesop's Fables, and indeed she does drop her bone--because she saw the escaped alligator that's taken up residence in the lake.

episodes.name: The Wrong Gift
episodes.overview: When Willy's expensive Mother's Day gift and Timmy's more frugal choice are mixed up, Timmy can't bear to tell his mother after seeing her pleased reaction--so he takes steps to earn the additional money Willy's gift cost.

episodes.name: The Fog
episodes.overview: The Martins' weekend camping trip turns dangerous when a treacherous fog envelops their camping area--and Timmy, stuck in a sinkhole in the swamp while searching for Lassie, is threatened by a maurauding wolf.

episodes.name: The Hermit
episodes.overview: Timmy befriends the hermit who recently moved into the area, a man a visiting construction worker and his son scorn.

episodes.name: Blacktail
episodes.overview: Jerry, the lame boy who adopted Lassie's son Blacktail, and his dog visit the farm, when the Martins find out Jerry can walk without his brace, but is afraid to try.

episodes.name: The Wallaby
episodes.overview: Something's raided the family strawberry patch, but the large mysterious tracks puzzle everyone until Timmy catches a glimpse of the animal, describing it as a ""giant rabbit."" In reality it's a wallaby named Pancho--who poses a danger to Lassie!

episodes.name: Cully's New Pet
episodes.overview: Cully tells Timmy no animal is all bad, so Timmy befriends a skunk, but no one, not even Lassie, will come near his new friend.

episodes.name: The Rescue
episodes.overview: Timmy is trapped on a ledge while chasing a strayed ewe that has just given birth and Ruth desperately tries to get the attention of a nearby helicopter pilot reseeding the hills.

episodes.name: Feathered Menace
episodes.overview: Ruth agrees to babysit Betty Wilder's infant twins, but the young mother arrives early and reluctantly leaves Timmy and Lassie to care for the babies until Ruth returns from an errand. Timmy thinks it will be a cinch--until a marauding hawk chases a frightened pigeon into the bedroom where the babies are sleeping.

episodes.name: The Gentle Tiger
episodes.overview: Timmy learns a lesson in obedience when he takes a job as water boy at a traveling carnival. He disregards an order, inadvertently allowing a tiger to escape from its cage.

episodes.name: The Renegade
episodes.overview: Timmy finds out that Bob Alder's dog Butch is going blind from cataracts and that Bob's father wants to have him put to sleep, so Ruth hires Bob to help with gathering corn to help pay for Butch's surgery. But Butch wanders away from the field where they are working.

episodes.name: The Blind Dog
episodes.overview: A blind dog is trapped in a skip-loader and in danger of being buried alive. Lassie risks her life to save the handicapped pup and Timmy helps the dog's owner find work to pay for a sight-restoring operation for his pet.

episodes.name: The Swallows of Los Pinos
episodes.overview: Timmy and Ruth try to prove that a little chapel should not be sleighted for demolition because a flock of swallows return there every year on the same day, but they may not arrive after a hawk attacks the scout swallow.

episodes.name: Sea Serpent
episodes.overview: Mistaking a fin print on the beach left by a diver for the tracks of a sea monster, Timmy and Culley Wilson let their imaginations get the better of them. They launch an attack on the would-be sea creature endangering the life of the diver.

episodes.name: Visiting Colt
episodes.overview: Timmy cares for a young colt during a neighbor's vacation, and doesn't realize until Lassie has twice saved the horse's life that he has neglected his oldest and best friend.

episodes.name: Little Cabbage
episodes.overview: Movie star Mimi Marlowe has car trouble near the Martin farm and is forced to leave her baby, a pet poodle, in Timmy and Lassie's care. Excitement ensues, as Lassie must save the poodle, which in turn rescues Timmy from a precarious situation.

episodes.name: The Big Race
episodes.overview: Timmy is punished for neglecting his farm chores when he joins Willie Brewster to build a vehicle for a go-cart race.

episodes.name: Bows and Arrows
episodes.overview: Timmy and Bob build their own bows and arrows to go ""hunting"" like the two bow hunters they met, but when Bob uses one of the hunter's arrows, he hits an unexpected target.

episodes.name: The Christmas Story
episodes.overview: The Martin's new neighbors turn out to be living in an abandoned shack with little food. Efforts to help are rebuffed by the father, but when the sheriff becomes involved, Timmy and Lassie find the father a job and the family enjoys a happy Christmas.

episodes.name: The White-Faced Bull
episodes.overview: A neighbor's prize bull strays onto the Martin farm and tries to attack Timmy. When the bull is later poisoned, the neighbor accuses Paul of the deed. Detectives Timmy and Lassie launch an investigation to find the real culprit.

episodes.name: Apron Strings
episodes.overview: When Timmy and Lassie bring home a litter of starving orphaned puppies, rescued from a maurading bobcat, the family tries to save them although one has already died of starvation. Inadvertantly, the pups teach Timmy, who's been relying on Paul to help him with arithmetic homework, about self-sufficiency.

episodes.name: The Wild Horse
episodes.overview: Timmy observes what he believes is a wild horse which becomes a menace to the local farms but persuades Paul to convince the local farmers to spare the life of the horse which is later learned to be an escaped thoroughbred.

episodes.name: The Mad Dog
episodes.overview: While Paul is away, Ruth and Timmy care for a stray dog that Timmy names Duke. But after being involved in a fight, Duke suddenly shows all the signs of rabies.

episodes.name: The Trip
episodes.overview: When the Martins travel by train to Chicago for an agricultural exhibition, as well as to visit Ruth's mother and family, Lassie is taken along, but her crate falls off the baggage car enroute and Tom and Jess, two friendly truckers, try to help her get back where she belongs.

episodes.name: Shadrack
episodes.overview: Cully plays host to his old regiment's Army mule, but he and Timmy must save the animal from being destroyed when it suddenly goes mad and begins rampaging all over the countryside.

episodes.name: The Patriot
episodes.overview: After finding out the local Army base needs dogs to guard their missiles, Timmy adopts Homer, a German Shepherd from the dog pound to give to the Army, but the dog has become so cowed from abuse that the family wonders if he can ever be trained.

episodes.name: The Eagle
episodes.overview: Timmy and Lassie watch in horror as a man raids a golden eagle's nest and destroys her only egg, so Timmy gives the bereaved bird a goose egg to raise.

episodes.name: Cracker Jack
episodes.overview: Enroute to the city to relocate after a drought, a backwoods family stops at the Martins after Timmy plays a trick on them. But when their son Billy Joe finds out his parents plan to give away his beloved dog Mitchell, he swears Timmy to secrecy after returning to the Martins', then he and the dog head for the woods--where deer season has just begun.

episodes.name: Cully's Hound Dog
episodes.overview: When Paul offers to farm the land Cully has allowed to lie fallow, the old man thinks Paul means he should retire. But after Timmy gives him a pep talk, Cully decides to fight back by hitching horse to plow and farming his land again.

episodes.name: The Fire Watchers
episodes.overview: Ruth is on volunteer tower duty during a dry spell and must take action when a forest fire starts due to a careless smoker. Meanwhile Lassie helps Ranger Wade start a backfire after he's injured in the path of the fire in a fall from his horse.

episodes.name: Senor Coyote
episodes.overview: Timmy befriends Jos, a new Spanish boy in school (the other boys keep calling him "Josie"), but doesn't know what to do when Jos's pet coyote Taquita is accused of killing Mr. Ransom's chickens.

episodes.name: Bessie
episodes.overview: When Ruth thinks their cow is going dry, she makes the difficult decision to sell Bessie to the slaughterhousea and purchase a new cow. What they don't realize is that a neighbor's boy has been stealing some of her milk.

episodes.name: The Pigeon
episodes.overview: Lassie and Caesar, an Army homing pigeon that Timmy nurses back to health, get so attached to each other that when he is returned to the Army, she refuses to eat, and Caesar frees himself to return to his collie friend. So Timmy decides to see if the Army will let him buy the bird.

episodes.name: Long Chase
episodes.overview: When carnival performer Mr. Conte's trained dog Terry is injured, Lassie substitutes for her--so well that he wants to buy her. When Timmy won't sell, the man steals her.

episodes.name: The Ostrich
episodes.overview: Timmy and Lassie make the acquaintance of Captain Gene Holter, a man who makes his living racing his two ostriches Romeo and Juliet against horses at county fairs. But when Ruth finds out Juliet, defending a egg she just laid, chased Timmy, she forbids the boy to return to the fairgrounds.

episodes.name: Fools Gold
episodes.overview: Lassie brings home a gold miner's pack burro, and Timmy and Culley get gold fever. The burro leads them to a mine, but their digging causes the roof to collapse, trapping them. Lassie and the fireman must rescue them before the mine fills with gas.

episodes.name: The Greyhound
episodes.overview: Timmy bets Lassie's new jeweled collar that she can beat a friend's new greyhound, Pat, in a race, and is chagrined when the collie loses.

episodes.name: Rodeo
episodes.overview: Timmy bets Lassie's new jeweled collar that she can beat a friend's new greyhound, Pat, in a race, and is chagrined when the collie loses.

episodes.name: The Search
episodes.overview: While playing on her own, Lassie brings home the talking doll belonging to a lost city child, who is trapped in a concrete irrigation ditch that's slowly filling with water.

episodes.name: Timmy and the Martians
episodes.overview: Timmy erroneously believes that his operation of a machine he and his friends have made to contact Martians has caused an army plane to crash but the army believes that Lassie's behavior at the time of crash is a clue to accident.

episodes.name: Lassie at the Grand Canyon
episodes.overview: Ruth and Timmy, visiting the Grand Canyon, befriend a blind pianist with a unique outlook on life who helps Timmy after he is angered by Lassie's behavior when she follows him on a mule ride and he's forced to turn back.

episodes.name: The Bloodhound
episodes.overview: Timmy and Lassie discover the sad truth about Relentless, Cully's new--and much bragged about--dog: he's lost his sense of smell. The truth might have remained secret had not the money earned in a church fundraising drive gone missing.

episodes.name: The Mysterious Intruder
episodes.overview: The Gardners, the Martins' new neighbors, accuse Lassie of killing their cat and attacking their sheep, but Lassie knows there's a strange collie in the area.

episodes.name: Lassie Adopts the Fire Chief
episodes.overview: When the fire chief's Dalmatian is killed at a fire, Timmy loans Lassie to the chief for during the day but Lassie becomes enthralled with the fire engine and fire chasing to the extent she ignores Timmy.

episodes.name: Lassie's Protege
episodes.overview: Lassie, lonely when Timmy returns to school after a vacation, befriends a raccoon.  She is devistated when the raccoon, whom Timmy named Melonhead, is run over by young drag racer Johnny Sexton.

episodes.name: Fine Feathered Friend
episodes.overview: Lassie is concerned over the fate of a magician's disappearing pigeon.

episodes.name: Quick Brown Fox
episodes.overview: Timmy and Lassie care for a pair of orphaned fox cubs.

episodes.name: Desperate Search
episodes.overview: Timmy promises his friend Andy that he'll care for his pregnant dog, but while taking her home, she is struck by a car and runs away.

episodes.name: Home Within a Home
episodes.overview: Cully's old barn is condemned for passage of a new gas line, but the old man can't get his animals to leave.

episodes.name: Deadly Goats
episodes.overview: Paul orders Timmy to keep an eye on the goats he has pastured in a canyon when one of them dies from anthrax, but he's careless and lets them escape.

episodes.name: Fawn Patrol
episodes.overview: Timmy and Lassie help ranger Mark Adams tag fawns for a conservation project.

episodes.name: Gentle Savage
episodes.overview: Timmy and Lassie care for a wild stallion suddenly tame after a fall down a cliff.

episodes.name: The Nest
episodes.overview: Timmy and Lassie aid a mallard duck who laid her eggs on the track of a soon-to-be-opened spur line.

episodes.name: Lassie's Ordeal
episodes.overview: Lassie is trapped on a rocky ledge at a construction site while trying to help a trapped fawn.

episodes.name: Howling Hero
episodes.overview: Smokey, the new fire dog, is afraid of fires.

episodes.name: A Career for Lassie
episodes.overview: Timmy and his new friend Danny, the son of a retired circus performer, decide to run away to join the carnival.

episodes.name: Show Dog
episodes.overview: Timmy and Lassie befriend a overworked Irish Setter doing promotions for a dog food company.

episodes.name: Eagle's Lair
episodes.overview: Timmy and Lassie help a wounded eagle by a having a goose lure her back to her nest to care for her babies.

episodes.name: Leave It to Lassie and the Beavers
Lassie and the Girl in the Canyon
The Old Man in the Forest
Lassie's Time of Peril
episodes.overview: A flooded river threatens to sweep away a bridge construction project. Ranger Corey Stuart and Lassie brave the raging waters in a small boat to construct a log chain barrier and control the flow of water and logs.

episodes.name: The Homesick Hound
episodes.overview: A bloodhound needs to be relocated, but he dislikes all his new abodes.

episodes.name: Lassie and the Buffalo
episodes.overview: Corey shows an old friend why a buffalo hunt will improve the quality of life in a herd while Lassie helps a perpetually straying calf get back to its mother, who is sleighted to be killed.

episodes.name: Danger Mountain
episodes.overview: While inspecting a ski area with the careless proprietor, Corey and Lassie find major infractions, but trouble is only starting when they are trapped at the top of a stalled ski lift with the now injured man.

episodes.name: Fly Away Home
episodes.overview: In the Franklin National Forest, a wetlands sanctuary, Lassie saves a Canada goose who was trapped in a fishing line and then attacked by bobcat, injuring her wing.

episodes.name: A Time for Courage
episodes.overview: Corey leaves Lassie with Ed, a novice smoke jumper injured in a fire, when he participates in a smoke jump. When Corey and his friend Lane, a veteran fire fighter, are trapped and Ed has the idea to send Lassie, with a transmitter, in to find them.

episodes.name: Lassie Baits a Bear
episodes.overview: When Corey devises a way to free a female bear from the pit trap she has been caught in, the animal ""repays"" him by attacking him and knocking him into the same pit.

episodes.name: Lassie the Voyager (1)
episodes.overview: While trying to find Corey, on duty in the thick of a hurricane, Lassie is trapped on a freighter which sails with her aboard.

episodes.name: Lassie the Voyager (2)
episodes.overview: Lassie, finally escaped from the freighter, swims ashore and assists an injured lighthouse keeper.

episodes.name: Lassie the Voyager (3)
episodes.overview: Lassie is put on trial for being a stray in Williamsburg, Virginia, and is defended by an elderly lawyer.

episodes.name: Lassie the Voyager (4)
episodes.overview: Lassie helps a lonely teenage mountain girl who attempts to protect her pet fox Riddle from a neighbor's boy and his hounds.

episodes.name: Lassie the Voyager (5)
episodes.overview: Lassie,continuing on his voyage, comes up on and helps an abandoned kitten.

episodes.name: Lassie the Voyager (6)
episodes.overview: Lassie joins two runaway boys who are rafting down the river to New Orleans; when their raft is lost, they decide to spend the night in a cave.

episodes.name: Lassie the Voyager (7)
episodes.overview: Unbeknownst to Corey, who is assigned a project in New Orleans, Lassie has also reached the cresent city.They end up just missing each other several times before finally meeting up again.

episodes.name: Little Jim
episodes.overview: Dan Casey's hope of winning the trotting races at the Franklin County Fair with his pony Little Jim is dashed when he is hurt in a fall from the sulky--until his granddaughter Maureen resolves to drive in his place.

episodes.name: The Greatest Gift
episodes.overview: Corey and Lassie stop to help young Johnny Conrad on their way to supervise the cutting of the national Christmas tree--but Johnny is heartbroken when he discovers the chosen spruce is ""the meeting tree"" his father, who is missing in action in Vietnam, and he used while on fishing and hunting trips.

episodes.name: Once Upon a Horse
episodes.overview: Corey and Lassie tame a wild stallion that was injured in a fall down a ridge and who will always be a little lame.

episodes.name: Interlude of Mercy
episodes.overview: Lassie is trying to defend a cougar cub from a vicious attack from a wolf.When she accidently slips and falls down the cliff and is hurt.But Lassie's good deed is repayed when the cougar cub's mother,cares for Lassie and nurses her back to health.

episodes.name: Crisis at Devil's Gorge
episodes.overview: While surveying the badlands of North Dakota,for use as a wilderness area, Corey is bitten by a rattlesnake; when his horse returns riderless to the corral, a fellow ranger and a pilot set up a desperate search for him.

episodes.name: Lassie's Litter Bit
episodes.overview: After Corey and a fellow ranger put up a trash display to remind tourists to clean up their litter, Lassie finds a well-meaning man tossing trash into a ravine--and after he leaves, a raccoon gets his head caught in a can the man left.

episodes.name: Day of the Bighorn
episodes.overview: Lassie helps an aging bighorn sheep who has been trapped and is helpless before a pack of wild dogs.

episodes.name: The Protectors
episodes.overview: In this,another of the classic Lassie all-animal episodes, Lassie and an eagle protect a helpless mother owl who was injured by a possum trying to steal her eggs. The eagle hatches the eggs and then feeds the chicks as the owl recovers and Lassie protects the nest.

episodes.name: A Matter of Seconds
episodes.overview: When the rangers have an area cleared for a vista stop, several wrecked cars must be towed away from the site. But a squirrel is trapped in the trunk of one of the vehicles and only Lassie knows it.

episodes.name: Never Look Back
episodes.overview: Luther Jennings, the elderly ranger manning the survey tower at Strawberry Peak, takes it hard when he finds he'll lose his job when the tower is slated for destruction. Then he's attacked by a jaguar while out on a walk.

episodes.name: The Eighth Life of Henry IV
episodes.overview: While Corey helps the town of Whitehorse Falls with modern forestry methods, Lassie has her hands--uh, paws--full with a mischievous kitten who can't seem to help endangering himself.

episodes.name: Lure of the Wild
episodes.overview: A coyote rescued and tamed by a fellow forest ranger and now returning to the wild again is stalked by a hunter, but Lassie and ""Monday's"" mate try to outwit the man.

episodes.name: Most Dangerous Game
episodes.overview: It's fire season in the Franklin National Forest and when a reporter interviews Corey about fire safety, he finds out most fires are caused by children playing with matches. Sure enough, Lassie soon finds a boy playing with matches who finally ends up setting a fire which she strives to put out.

episodes.name: Barney
episodes.overview: Ranger Corey Stuart and Lassie visit a turkey ranch where watchdog Barney has been injured in a fight with a lynx. The lynx successfully terrorizes the ranch as Barney shies away in fear, but when the lynx attacks Lassie, Barney must confront his fears.

episodes.name: Return of the Charm
episodes.overview: When Jeremy Boggs loses a good luck charm he acquired during World War II, Lassie returns to the place he lost it to track it down. A squirrel has stored it in a winter cache and Lassie must make a trade to regain the special stone.

episodes.name: Winged Attack
episodes.overview: Eddie, a racing pigeon enthusiast, takes his pigeon to an abandoned mine for a test flight. He falls through a mineshaft and sends his pigeon to bring help. Lassie and Ranger Corey Stuart must rescue the boy before heavy beams collapse in the mineshaft.

episodes.name: Goliath
episodes.overview: While in the Red River National Forest, Lassie tries to help a huge steer used as a roadside attraction at a tourist cafe, the mistreated animal having escaped after attacking the owner who has been abusing him.

episodes.name: Trapped
episodes.overview: While staying with elderly Ben Adams, Lassie befriends an otter couple--one of whom is later caught in a trap set by a neighbor.

episodes.name: Perils of the Prairie
episodes.overview: After a recent earthquake, Ranger Corey Stuart and Lassie survey the prairie for damage. Lassie comes to the rescue of a colony of frightened prairie dogs threatened by a tarantula and badger and caught in a flood caused by the quake.

episodes.name: Inferno
episodes.overview: When an oil well explodes in flames, a pet terrier is injured in the blast. Lassie rescues the dog and follows her to the hospital to donate the blood needed to save her life.

episodes.name: Cry of the Wild
episodes.overview: Corey and his partner Bert enlist a widowed sailplane pilot in a Forest Service project to learn about wind-shears; meanwhile, Lassie helps hunt a marauder that savaged a ranch's chickens.

episodes.name: The Guardian
episodes.overview: Lassie becomes the protector for a cougar, mistakenly shot as the ranch's maurauder, and her newborn cubs, while Corey accompanies Carol on her surveys.

episodes.name: Starfire
episodes.overview: Carol's unbroken mare escapes her corral and heads for the wilderness, oblivious to the danger from a maurading dog, while Carol must crash-land her glider.

episodes.name: Brink of Oblivion
episodes.overview: Ranger Corey Stuart and Lassie travel to northern California to alert the community to the dangers of littering. The message hits home when a small fire is fueled by trash and oil-soaked rags, trapping a small dog in a dockside office.

episodes.name: The Homeless
episodes.overview: Construction of a motel on Fawn Lake destroys the home of two ring-tailed cats. The homeless animals are separated and threatened by a stalking bobcat and Lassie must reunite them in a new home, far from encroaching civilization.

episodes.name: A Time for Decision
episodes.overview: Beauty takes a back seat to progress as urban growth threatens the lakeside community of Fawn Lake. Ranger Stuart recommends an anti-pollution campaign, but warnings go unheeded until a photo of Lassie at the pristine resort serves as a wake-up call.

episodes.name: Rim of Disaster (1)
episodes.overview: Ranger Corey Stuart and Lassie are stranded on a Glacier Peak when mechanical problems force their plane to land. In order to take off again, Lassie must be left on the ground, leaving her prey to a marauding bear.

episodes.name: Rim of Disaster (2)
episodes.overview: Ranger Corey Stuart must use his plane to save Lassie from the attack of a marauding bear.

episodes.name: Ride the Mountain
episodes.overview: Lassie is paralyzed by a falling log and, rather than travel several hours by road to a vet, she and Ranger Corey Stuart brave a death-defying ride on a nine-mile wooden log flume to reach the vet in time.

episodes.name: Dangerous Journey
episodes.overview: A tugboat owner is temporarily blinded while in the Columbia River basin. Following the path of a log flume, Lassie leads the helpless man through dangerous territory and into the hands of friends.

episodes.name: Fury at Wind River
episodes.overview: Hunters are pursuing a family of deer when Lassie intervenes to help them cross a raging river. All the deer cross safely except a playful fawn, which is swept downstream. Lassie plunges in the torrent to save the young deer.

episodes.name: Showdown
episodes.overview: A man who professes to be protecting the forest tries to sabotage the Forest Service's new balloon logging program. After shooting at Corey's truck, cutting a telephone line, and sabotaging a bulldozer, he's ready to do even more damage.

episodes.name: Miracle of the Dove
episodes.overview: A small girl's beloved dog is lost right before Christmas.

episodes.name: Have You Any Wool?
episodes.overview:
Lassie is out feeding her forest friends,when she comes upon a black lamb. The little creature was caught in a snare and being stalked by a coyote. Lassie chases away the coyote and chews the snare rope free. She is about to leave when the pathetically bleating lamb makes her realize it has no home. First she finds a flock of white sheep and the lamb runs up and eagerly nurses on a ewe. But the ewe doesn't recognize the black lamb as hers and savagely drives it away. Next they find a cow, and the lamb tries to nurse on her. But she kicks it away. By now the little fellow is so weak from hunger that Lassie wants to leave it while she reconnoiters, but a hawk appears, so first she must hide the lamb in some brush. To her relief, ahead she finds a flock of black sheep, but returns to find the hawk attacking the lamb, who has broken cover, and must fight the bird off.

To Lassie's relief, the black sheep accept the black lamb. But a white lamb is loose in the flock of black ones, being reje

episodes.name: The Bracelet
episodes.overview: Corey escorts Miss Ridgeway, a nature painter of renown, to a secluded area where she can work, leaving Lassie with her for company. When her insulin supply is destroyed after a lightning strike sets her cabin afire while she is away painting, Lassie must help get her back to the ranger station over a treacherous bridge before she goes into a diabetic coma.

episodes.name: The Foundling
episodes.overview: Corey, investigating a potential campsite at Emerald Forest, and Bill the resident ranger, are chagrined when well-meaning tourists rescue an ""abandoned"" fawn from the forest; believing the fawn's mother will not take it back, they plan to send it to a game ranch. But Lassie has other ideas.

episodes.name: Rescue Ridge
episodes.overview: Lassie rescues a coati-mundi's wayward kit--and a lost lamb as well--while Corey and his compatriots battles the forest fire threatening its home.

episodes.name: White Wilderness
episodes.overview: Lassie accompanies Ranger Corey Stuart on an avalanche control expedition. When the snow from a man-made avalanche buries a fox, Lassie must find the fox and dig her to the surface.

episodes.name: The Lost One
episodes.overview: While Corey is at Cape Kennedy participating in a paracute-testing project, Lassie encounters Atlas, a guard dog gone wild after the death of his master.

episodes.name: The Searchers
episodes.overview: Still in Florida, Corey and Lassie befriend Donnie Baker, whose puppy was run over while chasing a rabbit, and must rescue Atlas, trapped in the swamp.

episodes.name: Countdown
episodes.overview: Lassie has her hands full: she's reacclimating Atlas to society while keeping watch over a bald eagle injured during one of the parachute tests.

episodes.name: Escape to Danger
episodes.overview: An animal trainer's truck crashes in the woods, freeing his animals in the wilderness. Ranger Corey Stuart tends to the trainer's injuries as Lassie retrieves the escaped animals, just as a vicious lynx is threatening to make a meal of Zelda, the pet raccoon.

episodes.name: The Ledge
episodes.overview: A shutterbug Boy Scout is so intent on following an eagle to take a photo that he disregards where he is going and is trapped on a ledge.

episodes.name: Hanford's Point (1)
episodes.overview: Making a lake into a tourist attraction that will help a town depends on buying land from two independent boys the townspeople view as ""hippies.""

episodes.name: Hanford's Point (2)
episodes.overview: The Hanford boys refuse Corey's offer, to the outrage of speculator Wade, whose also worried because his teenager daughter Luci is attracted to ""the hippies.""

episodes.name: Hanford's Point (3)
episodes.overview: Wade faces off against the boys and is enraged when he finds out Luci has been helping them in their cause to keep their land from her father.

episodes.name: Lassie's Race for Life
episodes.overview: As Corey, Lassie, and a young woman consulting with the Forest Service on landslide prevention aid a poisoned goose, its mate waits faithfully by.

episodes.name: Burst of Freedom
episodes.overview: Lassie races for help after an earthquake traps Corey under a tree in the path of an incipient rockslide, but the motorist who picks her up nets and drugs her, selling her to a vet conducting animal experiments.

episodes.name: The Holocaust (1)
episodes.overview: A fire rages on a Western mountain range and, despite the efforts of helicopter crews, firefighters, and Lassie, Ranger Corey Stuart is trapped in the inferno. When a rescue team finally reaches Corey, he is seriously injured.

episodes.name: The Holocaust (2)
episodes.overview: Severely injured from a raging fire, Ranger Corey Stuart lies in a hospital with Lassie keeping vigil by his side in this conclusion to a two-part series. When Lassie is given to a new Ranger during Corey's recovery, she journeys miles to return to his side.

episodes.name: Last Frontier
episodes.overview: Lassie, Scott, and their pilot Johnny assist an injured hunter trapped near a glacier.

episodes.name: Eagle's Dynasty
episodes.overview: While Neeka's father and Scott nurse an eagle that has become sodden from a fall in the lake, Lassie protects the bird's baby from a lynx.

episodes.name: Day of the Wolf
episodes.overview: Neeka must take charge when Lassie breaks a leg in a trap on a hike--and a wolf is stalking them.

episodes.name: Glacier Canyon
episodes.overview: After surviving a boat explosion that traps Neeka's father, Lassie braves icy waters to find Neeka and Scott.

episodes.name: Track of the Jaguar (1)
episodes.overview: A jaguar has been attacking cattle and the watchdog on a Western ranch, and Lassie arrives to help. She gets some unexpected assistance when a cougar, foraging nearby, hears the battle and attacks the jaguar.

episodes.name: Track of the Jaguar (2)
episodes.overview: Lassie stands guard over the injured watchdog as the jaguar and cougar battle. The jaguar retreats in defeat and Lassie recognizes the cougar as a friend from days past. Lassie summons the rangers to eliminate the hostile jaguar for good.

episodes.name: New Horizon
episodes.overview: Ranger Scott Turner and a Scripps Oceanographic scientist, Diane Stafford, become trapped in a kelp bed during a deep-sea scuba dive. Lassie discovers their predicament and alerts Ranger Bob Erickson for the rescue.

episodes.name: Out of the Frying Pan
episodes.overview: Lassie twice comes to the rescue of a stray kitten that is first attacked by an angry hawk, then trapped in a cave by rising tides. The collie also finds time to retrieve a forest ranger's horse that has broken loose from his tether.

episodes.name: Lassie and the 4-H Boys
episodes.overview: Two brothers are quarreling over ownership of a prize bull that they are entering in the 4-H show. They must resolve their feud, however, when the bull strays and is lost in the mountains, with a marauding mountain lion close by.

episodes.name: Deadly Game
episodes.overview: Lassie's day with Jingo on his master's construction site turns too busy: first she pulls the beagle away from a blasting site, then, in trying to get him out of a house about to be demolished, Lassie is herself trapped.

episodes.name: What Price Valor? (1)
episodes.overview: Bruno, a war dog under rehabilitation, suffers from flashbacks after being exposed to blasting and escapes from his run. Warning the construction crew and local ranchers that Bruno is dangerous, Lassie, Bob, and his trainer Mike then try to find him before the others do.

episodes.name: What Price Valor? (2)
episodes.overview: In the second of a two-part series, Lassie finds Bruno, a retired war dog that has been spooked by dynamite explosions. Lassie tries to calm the frightened and confused canine, and must intervene to prevent ranchers from shooting the dog before his master arrives.

episodes.name: A Chance to Live
episodes.overview: On a trek through the Oregon rainforest, Lassie and her master discover a careless camper who has leaked oil into a stream, endangering hundreds of ducks on their seasonal flight. The Ranger and Lassie teach the camper a conservation lesson he won't soon forget.

episodes.name: The Return Home
